content: Welcome to our wedding website Jonathan fisher and Natanya villegas are excited to be getting married in september of 2026!
title: About

content:
Guests are welcome to camp with us in the rustic cabins at Camp Lane. Bring bedding and personal items for camping, showers and bathrooms will be available. It can get chilly at night and the cabins are unheated, so bring warm clothes and warm sleeping bags are recommended!
Staying with us There are five cabins that each have about 10 open dorm-style bunks (with foam mattresses) available for camping out. The cabins do not have heat or electricity in them. Food will be provided, but feel free to bring snacks and water bottles. The final checkout for Monday morning will be 10:00 am There may be RV parking (no hookups) available on request, so let us know if you’re interested in bringing your RV. Example of the cabins are shown below:
Cabin exterior Cabin interior Cabin bunk Staying nearby There are lodging options in Florence oregon which is about a 30-minute drive away or in Eugene which is about 45 minutes away.
Places to stay in Florence Places to stay in Eugene
title: Accommodations

content:
The Wedding We welcome guests to come for the ceremony and reception from 12:00 pm until 4:00 pm on Sunday September 20th of 2026! You can find our schedule here
Guests are also welcome to camp out with us the night before or the night after the wedding.
Our venue, Camp Lane, is an outdoor camp located on highway 126 about 45 minutes west of Eugene. The wedding will be held outdoors.
What to Wear Dress guideline for the ceremony: semi-formal The coast can be chilly or rainy in the fall, so bring jackets and warm clothes just in case! There are recreational opportunities for outdoor games (like volleyball and frisbee), swimming/wading, and campfires, so you can bring appropriate clothes and shoes if you want to participate. What to Bring Yourself! There will be a potluck/buffet-style meal provided for the reception, so feel free to bring your favorite fall dish, dessert, or side if you would like to contribute. If you want to camp with us, you should bring bedding (sleeping bags), personal toiletries, towels, and extra clothes and shoes. Bathrooms, bunks with pads, showers, electricity, and food will be provided. Camping out Rustic camping style accomodations are also provided for anyone who wants to stay the night before and/or after the wedding, just let us know in your RSVP so we can plan for meals. Florence and Eugene also have lodging options if you need a place to stay without camping. RVs may be allowed with prior approval, please contact us if you want to bring your RV. You can find more information in accomodations and location Respond to your invite Don’t forget to RSVP!
Wedding RSVP Form
title: Attending

content:
Gifts for the couple We do not have a registry, but you are welcome to give gifts if you would like to. We also appreciate gifts of time, money or resources to help make our wedding happen.
You can donate to our wedding using the link below

title: Gifts

content: Welcome! We invite you to attend our wedding on September 20th 2026 at 12:00 pm. The wedding will be at a summer camp style venue, and there will be optional camping activities and accomodations available. Here you can find information on how to attend, how to RSVP, how to camp at the wedding, photos, and more.
title: homepage

content:
Venue information The venue is Camp Lane, a summer camp style facility on the siuslaw river in Walton OR. More information can be found here:
Camp Lane Guests are welcome to come for the ceremony, reception, and also to camp overnight with us in the cabins!
There is parking available on site with bathrooms, covered dining, and kitchen facilities.
Activities At the camp, we have access to a volleyball court, walking trails, a grass sports field, river for swimming and wading, and campfire rings (dependent on fire danger level). There are also be indoor dining areas and a covered picnic shelter.
Directions from Eugene - go about 40 miles west on highway 126. After going through the town of walton around mile marker 23 the sign for Camp Lane will be on the right-hand side.
from Florence - go about 25 miles east on highway 126. The sign for Camp Lane will be on the left-hand side around mile marker 23.
title: Location

content:
RSVP Here Use this link below to RSVP:
Wedding RSVP Form Please respond no later than July 1st of 2026.
If you confirm your RSVP, we will send an email reminder prior to the wedding as well as any important updates and location information!
Information for your visit:
How many guests will attend in your party If you plan to camp with us If you have dietary restrictions Email contact information Helping out We welcome anyone who wants to help us with the wedding. Some things that would be helpful include:
Making decorations, signs, or flowers Helping with cooking for the campers Helping with the setup and/or cleanup for the site Donating basic food items for camp meals (eggs, oats, S’mores, fruit or veggies, etc) Check the appropriate box on the RSVP form or send us an email if you are interested in helping out!
Contact Us You can contact us at villagefish2026@gmail.com if you have any questions, concerns, or want to help!
title: RSVP

content:
Ceremony and reception The wedding will start at 12:00 pm on Sunday, September 20th 2026, Seating will begin around 11:30 am
The wedding reception will be held on Sunday the 20th from 1:30 pm until around 4:00 pm
Program of events:
Saturday, Sep. 19th wedding setup, 3:00 pm wedding rehearsal for the wedding party, activities for other campers/helpers 4:00 pm dinner for campers, campfire (if allowed) 5:30 pm quiet hours, 10:00 pm Sunday, Sep. 20th wedding preparation and breakfast for campers, 9:00 am wedding party pictures, 10:30 am guests begin to arrive, 11:15 am guests are seated, 11:30 am wedding ceremony begins, 12:00 pm family wedding pictures, 1:15 pm wedding reception and potluck meal, 1:30 pm recreational activities, 4:00 pm evening music and campfire (if allowed), 6:00 pm quiet hours, 10:00 pm Monday, Sep. 21st Wedding cleanup and breakfast for campers, 8:00 am all guests depart, 10:00 am final site checkout, 10:30 am
title: Schedule
